description:
You can now run Python 3.4 on microcontrollers that cost less than a cup
of coffee (in a up-market Parisian restaurant :)

MicroPython (http://www.micropython.org/) is a very active port of
Python 3 to low-end microcontrollers with minimal RAM (eg. 192k RAM,
yes: "k", as in kilobytes) but lots of useful I/O.

Learn how to set up a very cheap microcontroller with wifi and a range
of I/O and then program it with MicroPython.

The live demos are guaranteed to fail in spectacular ways as all live
demos do, but will hopefully show enough blinking lights to tempt you to
leave your i7 hyperthreaded clusters and join the cute but very
practical world of cheap, embedded Python.
title: Python for less than $7
